title: gamecenter_cx
body:
A long-running program on [[Fuji Television]], starring Yoiko member [[Arino Shin'ya]] as the section chief of fictional company Game Center CX. 

While the earliest seasons focused on Arino interviewing different game companies and learning about the backgrounds of their various works, this was later dropped. The series is well known for its "Arino's Challenge" (有野の挑戦状, [i]Arino no Chousenjou[/i]) segments, where Arino plays through and attempts to complete retro games with the help of his Assistant Directors and various other staff members. It was briefly brought over to the West in the late 2000's as [i]Retro Game Master[/i]. [[Nintendo]] eventually released a parody of the series in 2015 on its Youtube page titled [i]Gamecenter DX[/i], which has Arino's co-star Hamaguchi Masaru as a manager playing games that haven't been released.

In 2007, the series had a [[Nintendo DS]] game modeled after it: [i][[Gamecenter CX: Arino's Challenge]][/i], with a lot of the game's input coming directly from the show's staff. The game then got a sequel in 2009 and a [[Nintendo 3DS]] sequel in 2014.

h4. External links

* "Official Site":http://otn.fujitv.co.jp/gamecenter/index.html
* "Wikipedia Page (EN)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GameCenter_CX
* "Wikipedia Page (JP)":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%82%B2%E3%83%BC%E3%83%A0%E3%82%BB%E3%83%B3%E3%82%BF%E3%83%BCCX
* "Retro Game Challenge Official Site":http://www.retrogamechallenge.com/
* "Arino's Challenge Official Site":http://namco-ch.net/gamecenter_cx/index.php
* "Arino's Challenge 2 Official Site":http://www.bandaigames.channel.or.jp/list/gamecenter_cx/
* "3-choume no Arino Official Site":http://gamecenter.bngames.net
* "Retro Game Challenge Wikipedia page":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Retro_Game_Challenge
* "Arino's Challenge Wikipedia page":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/ゲームセンターCX_有野の挑戦状

title: fujiwara_no_mokou
body:
The "Crimson Watchguard". Extra Stage boss of [[Touhou]]'s [i][[Imperishable Night]][/i].

An immortal human with powers of [[fire|pyromancy]]. Mokou bears a deep grudge against [[Houraisan Kaguya|Kaguya]] for spurning her father's hand in marriage when the former was still young (humiliating him in the process), which caused her to steal and drink the Hourai Elixir as revenge. Upon reaching Gensokyo, she learned that Kaguya, too, was an immortal exile, and both have since engaged in countless fatal duels for fun.

When not picking a fight with Kaguya, she rescues lost people or guides them through the Bamboo Forest to Eientei, home of her own nemesis, or the Human Village, where her friend [[Kamishirasawa Keine]] lives, and claims to run a yakitori stand (which would put her at odds with [[Mystia Lorelei]]).

Became playable in [[Urban Legend in Limbo]] and [[Antinomy of Common Flowers]].

h4. See also

* [[Fujiwara no Mokou (young)|Young Mokou]]
* [[Fujiwara no Mokou (phoenix)|Phoenix Mokou]]
* "Emoting Mokou":[/pools/11667]

h4. External links

* "Touhou wiki: Fujiwara no Mokou":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Fujiwara_no_Mokou

title: houraisan_kaguya
body:
The "Eternal Lunar Princess". Final boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Imperishable Night]], imbued with the power of immortality.

The former princess of the Lunarians, banished to Earth for drinking the Hourai Elixir, which gave her immortality. She has since settled in Eientei, a mansion deep within a bamboo forest in [[Gensokyo]], where she came to love the humans she once detested and her new, easygoing life. Because of this, she is comically depicted in fanon as a [[NEET]] who is always dependent on her bodyguard and creator of the Hourai Elixir, [[Yagokoro Eirin]]. She is also the master of lunar rabbit [[Reisen Udongein Inaba]].

She shares a bitter rivalry with [[Fujiwara no Mokou]], daughter of one of her many spurned suitors. Both have since been killing each other for centuries, despite knowing that neither can permanently die.

h4. See also

* [[Kaguya Day]] (8th September)
* [[Kaguya Hime]] - the character from the folktale.
* [[Tasukete Eirin]] - a joke on her dependence on Eirin

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Kaguya Houraisan":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Kaguya_Houraisan
* "Wikipedia: The Tale of the Bamboo Cutter":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Tale_of_the_Bamboo_Cutter - the ancient Japanese folktale upon which Kaguya's character is based.

It consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[dress shirt]], a colored [[necktie]], a [[black sweater vest|black]] [[sweater vest]], an [[black jacket|black]] [[blazer]] with an [[emblem]] on the wearer's left, and a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]]. 

As [[Wien Margarete]] ([[Love Live! Superstar!!]]) wears a similar uniform, this may be used for her appearance in her middle school uniform as well.

title: cake
body:
A baked [[dessert]] made from a dough or thick batter usually containing flour and sugar and often shortening, eggs, and a raising agent.  They're often covered in either [[icing]] or frosting and decorated with embroidery, figures, flowers, or other toppings.

Cakes are frequently the dessert of choice used for ceremonial occasions, such as [[birthday|birthdays]] and [[wedding|weddings]].

Cake is a significant element in the [[Portal (series)|]] series.

h4. See also

* [[Cupcake]]
* [[Pastry]]

title: eustass_kid
body:
[[One Piece]] character. One of the [[Eleven Supernova]] and captain of the Kid Pirates. He is a rival of the fellow Supernovas [[Monkey D. Luffy]] and [[Trafalgar Law]]. During the timeskip, he challenged the Emperor [[Shanks (one piece)|]] and ended up losing his left arm after the battle with his first mate [[Benn Beckman]].

Having consumed the Jiki Jiki no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], he has powers over magnetism, allows him to attract or repel metallic objects as he please. After the timeskip, he use this power to attach his [[prosthetic arm]] on him, which also doubles as a [[railgun]].

title: real_life
body:
An illustration of a non-fictional character, or a famous person from real life, such as a celebrity, politician, athlete, musician, [[voice actor]], historical figure, or other public figure. 

Do not use for things that aren't illustrations of notable people from real life. This includes mythical figures, photos of random people, drawings of historical events or subjects, drawings of [[real world location]]s, and drawings of real world ships, planes, or cars. The purpose of this tag is to be the copyright tag for "characters" who are real people from real life, rather than fictional or [[original]] characters. If it's an illustration of an ordinary person, like the artist's friend or a stranger, use [[original]] instead.

h4. See also

* [[real life insert]]

* [[list of real life animals]]

title: blue-and-white_flycatcher
body:
Latin: [i]Cyanoptila cyanomelana[/i]
JP: オオルリ [i]ooruri[/i]

Adult male has royal blue upperparts, white belly, and black face, throat, and breast. (The immature male has blue wings and brown body, and the female is brown.)

Breeds in Japan and other areas of eastern Asia. 

Very similar visually to the [[bluebird]]. Look for a black face and throat, and white belly.

h4. See also
* "Blue-and-white Flycatcher on eBird":[https://ebird.org/species/bawfly2]
* [[Bluebird]]

title: hypnotic_convenience_store_(mankai_kaika)
body:
Original series by [[Mankai Kaika]] that started in August 2024. 

It follows the middle-aged shut-in Harami Kouta who, after the death of his father, is entrusted with their family’s convenience store. However, his poor social skills, shabby appearance and lack of confidence draw the ire of those around him, especially his coworker and boss.

One day, while mulling over his lot in life, Harami’s work tablet mysteriously changes and grants him the power to hypnotize people. With his newfound powers, he begins a series of lewd escapades with seven women of different backgrounds and occupations.

The series typically updates twice a month.

title: v-shaped_eyebrows
body:
Eyebrows that are slanted inwards, forming a V shape. Often used to indicate a sense of mischievousness or [[smug|smugness]], or alternatively [[angry|anger]] or [[annoyed|annoyance]].

[[V-shaped eyebrows]] is usually used in combination with emoticon tags:

* >:3 is {{:3 v-shaped_eyebrows}}

title: osu!
body:
A rhythm game that has gameplay consisting of clicking circles to the rhythm of a song. It was originally a simulator of the [[Nintendo DS]] game [[Osu! Tatakae! Ouendan]].

While the game can be played with a [[computer keyboard|keyboard]] and [[computer mouse|mouse]], [[drawing tablet]]s are also commonly used to emulate the playstyle of the original game.

title: shambler
body:
A fictional [[monster]] from the [[Quake (series)|]] series of [[video game]]s.

The [b]Shambler[/b] is a very big, white and hairy monster that looks very similar to a Yeti, but is much more dangerous. 

It can generate electricity and has enormous claws, as well as a maw with several sharp fangs. It lacks any eyes, but still can be very effective in finding its prey by unknown means.

title: ophiuchus_odysseus
body:
Unwilling major antagonist in [[Saint Seiya: Next Dimension]]. One of the saints from the 18th century.
 
Previously a Silver Saint of unknown constellation. He was well-versed in medicine, Odysseus took his own life years prior to the events of Next Dimension when he realized he was the reincarnation of the treacherous 13th [[Gold Saint]], Ophiuchus Asclepius.

[Spoiler]He is later resurrected due to effects of [[kido_saori|Athena]] traveling back in time to the 18th century. Shortly afterwards, he is possessed by Asclepius and becomes the thirteenth and most powerful gold saint of the Ophiuchus constellation.[/spoiler]

The Ophiuchus cloth is a [[gold armor|golden]] [[armored dress]] that provides even more protection than the other [[gold cloth|gold cloths]]. It is also armed with a [[rod_of_asclepius|gold serpent]] [[staff]]. In the modern day, the cloth has been reduced to the rank of a [[Ophiuchus_shaina|Silver Cloth]]. 
Odysseus has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair|white]] [[floating hair]]. [spoiler]
After his resurrection[/spoiler]; he gains prominent [[red eyeshadow|red]] and [[blue eyeshadow]], [[red lips|red]] [[lipstick]] and [[slit pupils]] to invoke the appearance of a snake. 
When Asclepius fully takes control of him, his hair additionally turns [[black hair|black]].
other_names: 蛇遣座のオデッセウス

title: virgin_killer_sweater
body:
A particular kind of [[backless dress|backless]] [[halterneck]] [[turtleneck sweater|turtleneck]] [[ribbed sweater|ribbed]]/[[aran sweater|aran]] [[sweater dress]] with a [[drawstring]] around the neckband that went viral from "this tweet":[https://twitter.com/magane4989/status/824236985334120448] on January 25th, 2017.

Most often seen worn [[naked sweater|naked]], although can be worn with clothes underneath such as in post #2616126. Frequent features include [[sideboob]], [[bare back]], [[bare shoulders]] and [[butt crack]]. Also can be seen [[wardrobe error|worn backwards]] such as in post #2611295.

Before magane4989's tweet, this sweater was shared by Japanese cosplayer Noraneko (のらねこ) under the term "スケベニット":[http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%82%B9%E3%82%B1%E3%83%99%E3%83%8B%E3%83%83%E3%83%88] (Perverted Knit) with "this tweet":[https://twitter.com/noraneko_skmz/status/752183713409085440] in June 2016. The corresponding tag on pixiv only received about 30 uploads prior to its boom in popularity when magane4989 named it thus.

[quote]
このセーター・・・エロい
童貞殺すセーター
[/quote]

[quote]
This sweater... is erotic
A virgin killer sweater
[/quote]

Also called "例のセーター":[http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E4%BE%8B%E3%81%AE%E3%82%BB%E3%83%BC%E3%82%BF%E3%83%BC] or [i]that[/i] sweater as with the [[open-chest sweater]], albeit to a much larger degree in comparison with the latter.

Not to be confused with the [[virgin killer outfit]], despite them sharing the same naming inspiration.

h4. Examples

* !asset #6121075: Origin

h4. See also

* [[backwards virgin killer sweater]]
* [[evolved virgin killer sweater]]
* [[virgin destroyer sweater]]
* [[virgin terminator sweater]]
* [[open-chest sweater]]
* [[virgin killer outfit]]
* [[meme attire]]

h4. External links

title: ammo_baron
body:
Reoccurring antagonist who debuted in [[Shantae: Risky's Revenge]]. One of the Barons of Sequin Land, thieving bandits who pass themselves off as artifact collectors.

He is a [[muscular_male|burly]], sleazy, militarized [[cyclops]] who leads an army of [[Ammonian Soldier]]s. He plans to one day conquer the entirety of Sequin Land himself. 

He wears a [[blue coat]] with an [[orange shirt]] underneath and [[brown pants]]. He has [[brown hair]] and a [[goatee]]. Him and his army all wear some sort of [[blue headwear|blue]] [[helmet]] that feature animalistic tails and ears, with the front of his featuring a [[:3]] face.

title: naked_school_attendance
body:
A subset of the [[zenra]] fetish involving students who are either not wearing certain clothing items (being [[topless female|topless]], [[bottomless]], etc.), wearing a [[revealing clothes|revealing]] [[school uniform]], or simply being [[nude]], with the students being oblivious to their state of undress or treat it as a normal activity.

Typically, the setting treats these impractical "uniforms" or nudity as their "school uniforms". Other settings might instead have a "nudity day", a special school day where all students and teachers must attend the [[school]] naked.

This is not limited to [[classroom]]s, as it also covers the commute to school these naked students take, often within the presence of other people who are otherwise wearing normal clothes. If it is the latter case, then the tag [[nudist]] and/or [[exhibitionism]] is applicable depending on the context.

h4. See also
* [[Nude beach]]

title: hypnosis
body:
A trancelike state in which a person becomes highly suggestible. A form of [[mind control]]. Usually indicated by a swinging [[coin]] or [[pendulum]] being used to hypnotize the person. Since mid-2010s, depiction of a [[hypnosis app]] on a [[smartphone]] has also became increasingly common.

This is usually a sexual fetish in which a person is hypnotized into performing sexual acts.

body:
A playable character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. 

A member of the [[Inherit (nikke)|]] squad along with [[Harran (Nikke)|]] and [[Noah (Nikke)|]]. An aerial pursuer with a twisted mind. She will track her target to the ends of the earth, regardless of whether they're friend or foe. It's because of her that Inherit is a force to be reckoned with in the skies. She has an [[yandere|obsession]] with the [[Commander (nikke)|]] and will do whatever it takes to keep them forever.

Like other members of Inherit, Isabel is named after a Biblical figure: in her case, a Spanish derivative of "Elisheba":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elisheba], the wife of Aaron, the brother of Moses.

She has [[red eyes]], [[medium hair|medium]] [[black hair]] and [[large breasts]]. She is a [[mecha musume]] with an [[armored leotard]], [[mechanical arms]], [[mechanical legs|legs]] and [[mechanical wings|wings]]. Despite not being shown carrying it, she uses a [[shotgun]].

Illustrator: [[dramz|D.ramz]]

h4. Costumes

* !post #5965652: Default
* !asset #25430892: [[Isabel (Honeymoon Party) (Nikke)|Honeymoon Party]]

title: tehepero
body:
A phrase coined by the [[voice actor|voice actress]] [[Hikasa Youko]], a combination of the onomatopoiea "tehe" for giggle and "pero" for sticking the [[tongue out]].

It is often rendered with a star 「てへぺろ☆」; the full emoticon is 「てへぺろ☆(・ω<)」, from "her 2009 blog post":http://blog.livedoor.jp/hiyonikki/archives/844295.html 

The archetypical facial expression and pose for [i]tehepero[/i] incorporates a cheeky grin with [[tongue out]], a [[one eye closed|wink]], and either one [[arm up]] behind the head (the left example below), or a [[v]] hand sign raised to the face (the right example below).

The pose is usually used in the Japanese pop culture as a way for the character to cover their mistake and brush it off with a cute expression.

h4. Examples

* !post #4587290
* !post #7251185

h4. Similar poses

Since [[one eye closed|winking]] and sticking the [[tongue out]] are both common facial expressions, an image should only be considered a reference to [i]tehepero[/i] and tagged as such if the complete [i]tehepero[/i] pose is emulated, or if a reference is made explicitly in text (i.e. 「てへぺろ」 in speech or sfx).

If the character is tapping their head while winking and sticking their tongue out, use [[dojikko pose]] instead; if they're touching their head with both hands with both eyes closed, use [[ah eto... bleh (meme)]].

h4. Non-examples

* !post #2775090: [[dojikko pose]] - she is tapping her head
* !post #8405310: [[ah eto... bleh (meme)]]

h4. See also

* [[;p]]
* [[;q]]
* [[ah eto... bleh (meme)]]
* [[dojikko pose]]
* [[one eye closed]]
* [[tongue out]]

title: atem
body:
One of the main characters of [[Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters]].

The Pharaoh of [[ancient Egyptian|ancient Egypt]] and the so-called "King of Games" for his talent that allows him to play and win any kind of games. After he died, he had his soul sealed inside the [[Millennium Puzzle]] [spoiler]in an attempt to seal the evil spirit [[Zorc Necrophades]][/spoiler]. [[Muto Yugi|Muto Yugi]] solves the puzzle and the Pharaoh inhabits his body, manifesting as the older version of Yugi, nicknamed [[Yami Yugi|Yami Yugi]].

While technically the same person as Yami Yugi, this tag refers to the "original" form of Atem. Specifically with darker skin than Yugi and/or with [[ancient Egyptian]] attire.

title: princess_amira
body:
Princess Amira is a [i][[Neopets]][/i] character. She is an [[Aisha (neopets)|]], and the ruler of Sakhmet (a location based on the [[ancient Egyptian|ancient Egypt]], found in the Lost Desert).

She is the daughter of the previous ruler, a Lupe named King Coltzan III.

title: blanka
body:
A character from [[Capcom]]'s [[Street Fighter]] fighting game series.

Blanka is a feral man from [[Brazil]] who is estrangled from his mother at his youth due to a plane crash over the Amazon forest, later revealed to be caused by Shadaloo to assassinate a politician on board. Being the sole survivor, he began to adapt with his new home and starting to behave and mutate like an animal, notably having his skin [[green skin|turned green]] and gained an ability to launch [[electricity]] at his enemy. After he was accidentally bought back to civilization by a poacher truck, he decided to enter the World Warrior tournament to find his mother, and later to learn more about civilization.

h4. See also

* [[Blanka-chan]]

title: chaos_kin
body:
A villainous entity from [[Kid Icarus Uprising]]. It is a [[scorpion]]-like monster with [[green wings]] and a [[one-eyed|single]] yellow eye, kept prisoner within [[Arlon (kid icarus)|]]'s Lunar Sanctrum because of the threat it posed.
It hides inside a bizarre realm known as the Chaos Vortex, and is able to feed itself with another creature's soul while [[possessed|possessing]] their body. In the game, [[Palutena]] spends at least three years under the Chaos Kin's control.

body:
A [[poker]] hand that is both a [b]straight[/b] and a [b]flush[/b], i.e. the cards have sequential values and are all of the same suit. It is the most valuable hand category.

title: hades_(saint_seiya)
body:
The final antagonist of the original [[Saint Seiya]] anime and manga. The God of the Underworld and ruler of the  [[specter_(saint_seiya)|Specters.]]

He manifests once every 243 years by possessing the body of the purest human alive in order to engage [[athena_(saint_seiya)|Athena]] and her Saints in the Holy War.
He views humans as arrogant creatures, detrimental to the Earth and its other inhabitants so he wishes to exterminate them all by blocking out the sun.

His most recent host was [spoilers][[Andromeda_Shun|Andromeda Shun]][/spoilers]. While in said host's body, he bears: [[pale skin]], [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]],  [[blue eyes]] and a [[robe|purple robe]].

In his true godly form he is quite tall, standing at 6'2". His hair is [[black hair|jet black]]. He is clad in a  [[black armor|black set of armor]] with [[multiple wings|multiple pairs of wings]]. He wields a sword in battle. [[Expressionless|His face changes very little]]. His appearance invokes that of the [[fallen angel]] [[Lucifer_(mythology)|Lucifer]].

In the previous Holy War, his host was a boy named [[alone_(saint_seiya:_the_lost_canvas)|Alone]].

h4. See also
* [[Poseidon_(saint_seiya)|Poseidon]]
* [[Pandora_(saint_seiya)|Pandora]]

* [[Thanatos_(saint_seiya)|Thanatos]]

title: gray_whale
body:
The [b]gray whale[/b] (Eschrichtius robustus) is a baleen [[whale]] that migrates between feeding and breeding grounds yearly. It reaches a length of 14.9 meters (49 ft), a weight of up to 41 tonnes (90,000 lb) and lives between 55 and 70 years.
The common name of the whale comes from the gray patches and white mottling on its dark skin.
Sometimes confused with the [[humpback whale]], but gray whales have shorter mouths and do not have a white underbelly.

title: days_of_future_past
body: "Days of Future Past" is a storyline in the Marvel Comics comic book The Uncanny [[X-Men]] issues #141–142, published in 1981. It deals with a dystopian future in which mutants are incarcerated in internment camps. An adult Kate Pryde transfers her mind into her younger self, the present-day [[Kitty Pryde]], who brings the X-Men to prevent a fatal moment in history that triggers anti-mutant hysteria.

Korea Train eXpress (한국고속철도), often known as KTX (케이티엑스, Keitiekseu), is South Korea's high-speed rail system, operated by Korail. Construction began on the high-speed line from Seoul to Busan in 1992. KTX services were launched on April 1, 2004.

title: class_8620
body:
The [[Japan Railways|JGR (Japan Government Railway)]] Class 8620 (8620形) is a type of 2-6-0 [[Steam Locomotive|Steam]] [[locomotive]] built in Japan from 1914 to 1929. It was Japan's first mass-produced passenger locomotive. A total of 672 Class 8620 locomotives were built. Originally they had a symmetry of line with shapely cast iron chimneys which gave way to plainer chimneys and smoke deflectors were added in later years.

This steam locomotive was popularized by [[Maitetsu]] with a [[personification]] of the steam locomotive [[Hachiroku (Maitetsu)]], and in [[Kimetsu No Yaiba|Demon Slayer]] as the Mugen Train.

h4. Examples

title: h5_hayabusa
body:
The H5 series (H5系, H5-kei) and the related [[E5 Hayabusa|E5 series]], are Japanese Shinkansen high-speed train types built by Hitachi Rail and Kawasaki Heavy Industries.

The H5 series, a cold-weather derivative of the E5 series, is operated by Hokkaido Railway Company (JR Hokkaido); it has been in use on Tohoku and Hokkaido Shinkansen services since 26 March 2016. Ordered in February 2014, a total of four 10-car sets were built by Hitachi and Kawasaki Heavy Industries. The first two sets were delivered in October 2014.

For the normal variant (pink stripe), please use [[E5 Hayabusa]],

title: e5_hayabusa
body:
The E5 series (E5系, E5-kei) and the related [[H5 Hayabusa|H5 series]], are Japanese Shinkansen high-speed train types built by Hitachi Rail and Kawasaki Heavy Industries.

The E5 series is operated by [[East Japan Railway Company|East Japan Railway Company (JR East)]]; it was introduced on Tohoku Shinkansen services on 5 March 2011 and on Hokkaido Shinkansen services on 26 March 2016. A total of 59 10-car sets are on order, with three sets in service in time for the start of new Hayabusa services to Shin-Aomori in March 2011.

title: jr_east_e231_series
body:
The E231 series (E231系, E231-kei) is an [[Multiple Unit Train|electric multiple unit]] ([[Multiple Unit Train|EMU]]) [[train]] type used for commuter and outer-suburban services operated by [[East Japan Railway Company|East Japan Railway Company (JR East)]] in Japan

The type evolved from the earlier [[JR East 209 series|209 series]] and E217 series [[Multiple Unit Train|EMU]]s, and the prototype train built in 1998 for trials on the Chūō–Sōbu Line was actually classified 209-950 series, later becoming E231-900 series. Full-production E231-0 series trains were subsequently introduced on the Chūō–Sōbu Line (10-car sets) and Jōban Line (10+5-car sets). Other variants include the 11-car E231-500 series for the Yamanote Line, and the E231-800 series with 2,800 mm (9 ft 2 in) wide bodies and end doors for use on Tokyo Metro Tozai Line inter-running services.

title: russian_empire
body:
The [b]Russian Empire[/b] was a vast autocratic state that existed from 1721 to 1917, ruled by the Romanov dynasty. Proclaimed by [[Peter the Great]] after the [[Tsardom of Russia]], it spanned Eastern Europe, Northern Asia, and parts of North America (notably [[Alaska]]) at its peak. Known for its centralized monarchy, [[orthodox_cross|Orthodox]] Christian heritage, and expansive territorial conquests, the empire ended with the [[February Revolution]] and the abdication of Nicholas II in 1917.

h4. History
Founded in 1721, the [[Russia]]n Empire modernised under Peter the Great, who introduced Western reforms and built the new capital, Saint Petersburg. The empire grew through wars, including victories over the Swedish Empire and the Ottoman Empire, and annexed regions like Poland, Siberia, and the Caucasus. The 19th century saw the height of its power under [[Alexander I]] and [[Nicholas I]], but internal unrest, serfdom, and defeat in the [[Russo-Japanese War]] (1904–1905) weakened it. The 1917 Revolutions marked its collapse, leading to the rise of the Soviet Union.

h4.Symbolism
The [[double-headed eagle]], a symbol of imperial authority, adorned the empire’s coat of arms. The [[Imperial Russian flag|tricolor flag]] (black, yellow, white) served as an imperial banner, reflecting the dynasty’s colors. [[orthodox_cross|Orthodox Christianity]] played a central role, with the [[Tsar]] seen as God’s anointed ruler.

h4. Related tags

* [[Imperial Russian flag]]
* [[Imperial Russian Army]]
* [[White Army]]

title: i_am_weasel
body: I Am Weasel is an American animated television series created by David Feiss for [[Cartoon Network]]. It is the fourth of the network's Cartoon Cartoons and the final to be produced solely by Hanna-Barbera and Cartoon Network Studios. The series centers on I.M. Weasel (voiced by Michael Dorn), a smart, noble and successful weasel, I.R. Baboon (voiced by Charlie Adler), an idiotic and arrogant baboon who is envious of Weasel and acts as both his rival and friend, and the mischievous, flamboyant Red Guy (also voiced by Adler), who returns from [[Cow & Chicken]].

title: cocktail_dress
body:
A [[dress]] suitable at semi-[[formal clothes]] occasions, sometimes called cocktail parties.

Cocktail dresses emphasize practicality. They are traditionally meant for cocktail parties, but can also be worn at bars, clubs and parties in a modern setting. Because of the practicality emphasis they are [[short dress|short]] to [[medium dress|medium]] length. If the dress is mid-calf to full-length, consider using [[evening gown]] instead.

title: stop_right_there_you_two
body:
待ちたまえ君たち ([i]Machitamae Kimitachi[/i]) is one of the various minor internet [[meme]]s that arose out of conversation threads on [[Futaba Channel]].
This is how [[Metalder]] interrupted an argument between Princess [[Rein (futagohime)|]] ([[blue hair]]) and Princess [[Fine (futagohime)|]] ([[red hair]]), from [[Fushigiboshi no Futago Hime]]. Although this was a minor meme, it has been extremely long-lived, and because two-tone heroes and women with strange hair colors are extremely common in anime, games, and manga, this meme will probably never die.
[quote]
No Title posted at Aug 4, 2005 (Thu) 01:46:46 a.m. by Toshiaki (Anonymous), Msg#2887574
The relationship between hair color and personality in gal games:

Black (or brownish): princess, pure and innocent (Attached image: [[Amuro Ray]])
Red: boundlessly cheerful, earnest, spunky (Image: [[Haman Karn]])
Blue: cool-headed and taciturn, mysterious (Image: [[Kamille Bidan]])
Blonde: high-maintenance, [[tsundere]] (Image: [[Yazan Gable]])
[/quote]
[quote]
No Title posted at Aug 4, 2005 (Thu) 04:28:56 a.m. by Toshiaki, Msg#2893891
What about green?
[/quote]
[quote]
No Title posted at Aug 4, 2005 (Thu) 04:30:18 a.m. by Toshiaki, Msg#2893933
Green: airhead
[/quote]
[quote]
No Title posted at Aug 4, 2005 (Thu) 04:31:42 a.m. by Toshiaki, Msg#2893977
(Attached image: Princess [[Rein (futagohime)|]]) "No way!! You red ones are the airheads!!"
[/quote]
[quote]
No Title posted at Aug 4, 2005 (Thu) 04:32:48 a.m. by Toshiaki, Msg#2894005
Also, Pink: They are sluts.
[/quote]
[quote]
No Title posted at Aug 4, 2005 (Thu) 04:33:16 a.m. by Toshiaki, Msg#2894019
(Attached image: Princess [[Fine (futagohime)|]]) "You blue ones are black-hearted back-stabbers!!"
[/quote]
[quote]
No Title posted at Aug 4, 2005 (Thu) 04:33:57 a.m. by Toshiaki, Msg#2894030
(Attached image: Scene of the two characters face-to-face)
""Grrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr"" 
[/quote]
[quote]
No Title posted at Aug 4, 2005 (Thu) 04:34:10 a.m. by Toshiaki, Msg#2894036
(Attached image: [[Metalder]]) "Stop Right There, You Two!"
[/quote]

title: wipers
body:
A windscreen wiper (Commonwealth English) or windshield wiper (American English) is a device used to remove rain, snow, ice, washer fluid, water, or other debris from a vehicle's front window. Almost all motor vehicles, including [[car]]s, [[truck]]s, [[bus]]es, [[train]]s, [[locomotive]]s, and [[watercraft]] with a cabin, and some [[aircraft]]s are equipped with one or more such wipers.

title: kaga_sumire_(2nd_costume)
body:
The 2nd/casual [[official alternate costume|costume]] and 2nd default of [[VSPO!]]'s [[Kaga Sumire]], released on the 28th of November, 2018, just a month after she debuted her first stream on the 20th of October, 2018. Soon after its debut, it would replace her [[kaga sumire (1st costume)|original default]]. It would receive two remakes, first on the 13th of August, 2021, and then on the 8th of June, 2024. As her default costume, it would be succeeded by her [[kaga sumire (4th costume)|4th costume]].

It consist of a [[black hat|black]] [[beanie]] with a [[cat hat|cat ear]] shape on top, and she's also wearing a [[black choker|black]] [[pendant choker]] and a single floral [[single earring|earring]], torso consists of [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], with a [[square-end necktie|square-end]] [[purple necktie]], ornamented with chains and [[tie clip]]. She also clad a [[black jacket]] styled to slip [[off shoulder|off the shoulders]] showing her [[bare shoulders]], a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[black skirt]], with a [[single garter strap]] attached to a black [[thigh strap]] and a [[single thighhigh|thigh-high]] on her [[asymmetrical legwear|right leg]] and [[black boots|black]] [[ankle boots]].

For [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]], she originally styled as [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] with a long [[hair between eyes|bang between her eyes]], but after the redesign, she styled in her [[kaga sumire (5th costume)|current default]], [[medium hair|medium length]] [[grey hair]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #3262372: Profile
* !post #8609333: Merchandise

h4. External links

title: shinkansen_500_series
body:
The 500 series (500系, Go-hykau-kei) is a [[Shinkansen]] [[high-speed train]] type operated by [[West Japan Railway Company]] (JR-West) in Japan on the Tōkaidō Shinkansen line from 1997 until 2010, and the San'yō Shinkansen line since 1997 and 2008. They were designed to be capable of 320 km/h (199 mph) but operated at 300 km/h (186 mph), until they were retired from the primary Nozomi service in 2010.

Since 7 November 2015, set V2 runs in a special "500 Type Eva" livery as part of the "Shinkansen:Evangelion Project" tie-up project to mark the 40th anniversary of the Sanyo Shinkansen and the 20th anniversary of [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]]. Initially planned to operate until March 2017, this livery was extended until 13 May 2018. From 24 February until 7 May 2018, the 500 series car preserved at the Kyoto Railway Museum was exhibited in the "500 Type Eva" livery.

In March 2018, JR West announced the launch of a special "[[Hello Kitty]]" themed 500 series train on Sanyo Shinkansen Kodama services.

h4. Examples 

* !asset #23691266: JR West Shinkansen 500 Series
* !asset #23691275: W Set's T-style Current Collector/[[Pantograph]]

title: class_dd51
body:
The Class DD51 (DD51形) is a B-2-B wheel arrangement [[Diesel locomotive|Diesel-hydraulic]] [[locomotive]] type operated in Japan since 1962. 649 [[locomotive]]s were built between 1962 and 1978 by Kawasaki Sharyo, Hitachi, and Mitsubishi. The class was designed for mainline passenger and [[Freight train|freight]] use with more power than the [[Class D51|D51]] and a higher maximum speed than the [[Class C62|C62 steam locomotive]] classes.

h4. Examples 

* !asset #23120985: [[Japan Railways|JR]] Class DD51

h4. See also

* [[Diesel locomotive]]
* [[Train]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: JNR Class DD51":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JNR_Class_DD51]

title: orlik_armoured_train
body:
Orlik, Zaamurets, among other names, was an [[armored train|armored]] [[train]] built by the Russian Empire in 1916. While originally made to fight in the First World War, it was extensively used in the Russian Civil War by Bolshevik forces and most notably the Czechoslovak Legion, before being used by the White Movement to serve Chinese warlords. During its service it was frequently renamed and nicknamed as it changed hands and traveled across Eurasia.

h4. Examples

* !asset #23977227: Zaamurets

h4. See also

* [[Armored Train]]
* [[Train]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Zaamurets":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zaamurets]

title: e6_komachi
body:
Formerly known as "Super Komachi". The E6 series (E6系) is a Japanese [[Shinkansen]] [[high-speed train]] type operated by [[East Japan Railway Company]] ([[East Japan Railway Company|JR East]]) on Komachi "mini-shinkansen" (Shinkansen on non-high-speed line) (services on the Tōhoku Shinkansen and Akita Shinkansen from Tokyo to Akita since 16 March 2013. A pre-series set was delivered in June 2010 for extensive testing, with 23 full-production sets delivered between November 2012 and spring 2014

The 7-car [[e6_komachi|E6 series]] trains operate in conjunction with [[E5 Hayabusa|E5 series]] or [[H5 Hayabusa|H5 series]] (since March 2016) 10-car trains, initially on just four return services daily from 16 March 2013. They replaced all of the previous [[E3 Tsubasa|E3 series]] trains on Komachi services by 15 March 2014.

h4. Examples 

* !asset #23642147: Shinkansen E6 Komachi 
* !asset #23524668: [[E5 Hayabusa]] coupled together with [[E6 Komachi]]
* !asset #23642157: [[E5 Hayabusa]] coupled together with [[E6 Komachi]]
* !asset #23642169: Shinkansen E6 Komachi coupling with [[E5 Hayabusa]]

h4. See also

*** [[E5 Hayabusa]]
*** [[H5 Hayabusa]]

** [[E6 Komachi (Shinkalion)]]

title: macross
body:
[i][b]MACROSS[/b][/i] (マクロス, [i]MA-KU-RO-SU[/i]) is a long-running and popular series of military [[science fiction]] [[Mecha]]/Real Robot anime, created by [[Kawamori Shouji]] of Studio Nue in 1982.

The franchise features a fictional alternate history of Earth and humanity after the year 1999. It is sponsored by [[Big West]].

The franchise is also notable for incorporating "love triangle" drama and musical elements akin to that of an idol anime as a plot device. Typically explained as being a source of inspiration for the protagonists and, in later series, a source of "sonic power" for various mecha within its fictional universe.

title: laboon
body:
[[One Piece]] character. A [[oversized animal|giant]] [[whale]] who is living around Reverse Mountain on the Red Line with his caretaker [[Crocus (one piece)|]]. His head is covered with scars due to his futile attempt to break the gigantic Red Line cliff in order to reunite with his friends, the long-dead Rumbar Pirates.

It turns out that one member of the Rumbar Pirates, [[Brook (one piece)|]] was resurrected after his death due to his Devil Fruit powers. As such, Brook aims to reunite with Laboon after his journey with the [[Straw Hat Pirates]] has concluded.

title: crocus_(one_piece)
body:
[[One Piece]] character. A lighthouse keeper of the Reverse Mountain and a doctor who lives on the Red Line with the giant whale [[Laboon]], who he is taking care of.

[spoiler]28 years ago, Crocus joined the Roger Pirates as [[Gol D. Roger]]'s personal doctor to help him prolong his life from an incurable disease. He is one of the only few people who have witnessed the One Piece and knew of its true nature.[/spoiler]

title: train_station
body:
A train station, railroad station, or railway station. Is a [[railroad tracks|railway]] facility where [[train]]s stop to load or unload passengers, [[freight train|freight]], or both. It generally consists of at least one [[train station platform|platform]], one [[railroad tracks|track]], and a station building providing such ancillary services as ticket sales, waiting rooms, and baggage/freight service.

body:

title: qungua
body:
A type of two-piece [[hanfu]] set worn by originally by Han Chinese [[bride]]s. The "qun" in qungua means skirt, and "gua" means jacket. 

Often red and gold in color. It can be distinguished by its complex embroidery, depicting designs of such things like dragons, phoenixes and flowers.

title: 500_cigarettes_(meme)
body:
A meme from the TV show [[The Orville]], to be specific during Season 2 Episode 11.

This meme is used for parodies of the scene, with 2 characters ordering from "the Food Synthensizer" for 500 (in numerical amounts) of any specific thing.

Curiously enough, in the original scene, where they order 500 cigarettes, only exactly 464 are shown instead.

title: zither
body:
Zithers are a class of stringed [[instrument]]s. In modern terminology, it is an instrument consisting of many strings stretched across a thin, flat body. 

* !asset #23232672: [[Zither]] (umbrella tag for varying types of zithers)

h4. Instruments in the Zither family

* !asset #23239143: [[Gayageum (instrument)|]] (가야금) - 12 strings
* !asset #23239251: [[Guqin]] (古琴) - 7 strings, lacks frets
* !asset #23232597: [[Guzheng]] (古箏) - 16 to 23 or more strings
* !asset #23244439: [[Kantele]]
* !asset #23238974: [[Koto (instrument)|]] (箏) - typically 13 strings

h4. See also

title: grand_piano
body:
A type of acoustic [[piano]] whose strings, frame and soundboard are laid out horizontally. Can be found in varying lengths between roughly five and ten feet, from the keyboard at one end to the tail at the other. Such an instrument carries a much larger footprint than an upright piano or spinet, but makes a much greater sonic and visual impact.

Occasionally, an electric or digital piano will be mounted in a grand piano-shaped [i]case[/i], such as found at post #527947.

h4. Examples 

* !asset #23242107: "Source: Wikimedia":[https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Steinway_%26_Sons_concert_grand_piano,_model_D-274,_manufactured_at_Steinway%27s_factory_in_Hamburg,_Germany.png]

h4. See also

* [[instrument]]
* [[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

body:
A type of acoustic [[piano]] whose strings, soundboard and frame are laid out vertically, rather than horizontally as in the case of a [[grand piano]]. This makes for a more compact form factor at the expense of maximum volume, both factors which support apartment use.

title: violin
body:
A musical [[instrument]] of the string family. Basically it consists of a formed, resonating box over which are suspended a fingerboard and four tightened strings. The player holds the larger end under the chin and the opposite end in the hand. Meanwhile, the other hand draws a [[bow (music)|]] over the strings to make them vibrate; alternately, this strings can be plucked. Said vibrations are amplified in the resonator. 

The violin produces notes in the [[treble clef|treble]] range. It may be played with the performer sitting (usually in a chamber or [[orchestra]] setting) or standing (often in a solo context). In folk or country music settings, the instrument is often labeled "fiddle."

h4. Examples

* !asset #23229745: "Source: Wikimedia":[https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Violin_VL100.jpg]

h4. See also

* [[bow (music)|]]
* [[viola (instrument)|]]

* [[double bass]]
* [[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Violin":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Violin

title: viola_(instrument)
body:
A musical [[instrument]] related to the [[violin]] and [[cello]]. It is played in much a similar fashion. but due in part to a larger body and longer strings, the viola plays in a lower range than its violin counterpart. Music written for viola usually appears in alto clef.

h4. Examples

title: bandura
body:
A bandura (Ukrainian: бандура) is a [[Ukraine|Ukrainian]] plucked-string folk-[[instrument]]. It combines elements of the [[zither]] and [[lute (instrument)|]] and, up until the 1940s, was also often called a kobza. Early instruments (c. 1700) had 5 to 12 strings and resembled lutes. In the 20th century, the number of strings increased initially to 31 strings (1926), then to 56 strings – 68 strings on modern "concert" instruments (1954).

h4. Examples

* !asset #23222360: "Source: Wikimedia":[https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Chernihiv-style_bandura.jpg]

h4. See also

* [[Harspiel]]

h4. External links

* https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bandura

title: aria_company_uniform
body:
The uniform worn by the ARIA Company of [[Undine (aria)|]] gondoliers  in [i][[ARIA (manga)|]][/i]. It has 2 different variations depending on the season:

The [[summer uniform|summer]] version consists of a blue-trimmed, [[sailor collar|sailor-collared]], [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt]], worn over a [[long dress|long]], [[white dress|white]] [[sleeveless dress]]. The blouse is rather short, reaching only bellow the breasts and features a [[patch]] with the company name on the left sleeve and blue [[chevron (symbol)|]] on the other.

The [[winter uniform|winter]] version replaces the blouse with a [[white capelet]] with yellow or [[gold trim|golden trims]] and a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]], [[high collar|high-collared]] [[white dress]], a long-sleeved [[white shirt|white]] [[undershirt]] and [[purple pantyhose]]

The dress in both versions has blue trims and prominently features the company [[logo]] in blue on both the front and the back, and is surprisingly [[skin tight]], almost to the point of being an [[impossible dress]] and has a cutout either on the front or the [[side slit|side]] of one of the legs.

Both versions feature [[white boots|white]] [[ankle boots]], a [[blue bowtie]] and a [[white hat|white]] [[sailor hat]] with a [[blue ribbon|blue]] [[hat ribbon|ribbon]] and the company logo on the side.

h4. See also
* [[Himeya Company uniform]]
* [[Orange Planet uniform]]
* [[List of Uniforms]]

title: deaf
body:
Deafness is a condition that describes the loss of hearing in a person or [[animal]]. Deafness can be partial or total, meaning a person may be able to hear some amount of sound, or none at all. Deafness can be present at birth, which is known as congenital deafness, if it develops before a child has learned to speak its known as "prelingual deafness":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prelingual_deafness]. Deafness can also develop later in life.

Tag what you see, not what you know, so this tag is not used to simply tag images of characters who are canonically deaf. Use this tag if the image directly relates to deafness. This tag is used for images wherein it's shown that the subject is deaf.

Types of images where [I]Deaf[/i] may be an applicable tag:

* Images wherein the character declares themselves or another to be deaf. 
* Showcases of situations wherein a characters deafness may cause awkwardness or some sort of unusual situation.
* Images where characters use [[sign language]] or non-verbal communication because of their or anothers deafness. 
* Posts wherein a person is using some kind of [[hearing aid]]

title: yassification_(meme)
body:
Yassification is giving someone or something a glow-up or makeover. As this term sprout from LGBT circles and social media overall, to yassify means to make something better or queerer. 

References to yassification typically include girly hand gestures like [[limp wrist]], [[finger to cheek]], holding [[handheld electric fan]]s and/or applying [[makeup]] / beauty filters to otherwise masculine looking characters for contrast. 

h4. See also 

* [[LGBT pride]]

h4. External links

* "Wikitionary":[https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/yassification]

title: 2017_central_mexico_earthquake
body:
The [b]2017 Central Mexico Earthquake[/b] struck at 13:14 CDT (18:14 UTC) on 19 September 2017 with an estimated magnitude of Mw 7.1 and strong shaking for about 20 seconds. It was epicentered about 55 km (34 mi) south of the city of Puebla. The earthquake caused damage in the Mexican states of Puebla and Morelos and in the Greater Mexico City area, including the collapse of more than 40 buildings.

Although Mexico's SASMEX earthquake warning system gave 20 seconds' advance notice in Mexico City, 342 people were killed throughout the region (including 203 in Mexico City), and more than 6,000 were injured.

Twelve days earlier, the even larger "2017 Chiapas Earthquake":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2017_Chiapas_earthquake struck 650 km (400 mi) away, off the coast of the state of Chiapas, damaging many of the buildings that collapsed in the later September 19 earthquake.

The last quake coincidentally occurred on the 32nd anniversary of the "1985 Mexico City Earthquake":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1985_Mexico_City_earthquake , which killed around 10,000 people. 

The 1985 quake was being commemorated that day, and a national earthquake drill was held, at 11 a.m. local time, just two hours before the 2017 earthquake. According to experts "this coincidence actually may have saved thousands of lifes":http://www.euronews.com/2017/09/20/mexico-quake-evacuation-drill-may-have-saved-lives .

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2017_Central_Mexico_earthquake

title: idolmaster_cinderella_girls_starlight_stage
body:
A free-to-play collectible [[card (medium)|]] and rhythm mobile game and spin-off of [[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls]].

The game combines much of the existing gacha mechanics of its predecessor with rhythm gameplay and live 3D performances of both [[Idolmaster Cinderella Girls|Cinderella Girls]] songs and new ones original to [i]Starlight Stage[/i]. In addition to sharing music and characters, many of the same cards appear in the spin-off with expanded and revised illustrations.

Unlike its parent series, the [[Producer (idolmaster)|]] works for 346 Production, and the anime original character [[Executive Mishiro]] is its Executive Director.

[i]Starlight Stage[/i] was co-developed by Cygames and Bandai Namco Entertainment and originally released on September 3rd, 2015 for Android, and on September 10th, 2015 for iOS.

title: gundam_battle_operation_2
body:
[b]Mobile Suit Gundam: Battle Operation 2[/b] is a free-to-play team battle and [[mecha]] action online multiplayer [[video game]] developed by "B.B. Studio":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/B.B._Studio and published by [[Bandai]] [[Namco]] Entertainment. The game is set in the [[Gundam]] universe.

The player is a [[mobile suit]] pilot member of the P.M.U. (Private Military Union) mercenary group and fights in missions and battles using several different mecha from the Gundam U.C. (Universal Century) era. 

Battle Operation 2 was released for Personal [[Computer]]s and the [[PlayStation 4]] home console in 2018, and was later ported to the [[PlayStation 5]]. It is still active to this day.

The PS4 version is notable because it's one of the few online multiplayer titles in that system that can be played completely for free without the need of purchasing a [i]PlayStation Plus[/i] subscription service.

h4. Some original Non-Playable Characters (NPC) from the game

* [[Katarina Wenders]]

title: metroid_dread
body:
[[Metroid]] game that was announced at Nintendo's E3 presentation 2021.

Following the events of [[Metroid Fusion]], [[Samus Aran]] takes on a bounty to investigate what happened to the [[E.M.M.I. (metroid)|]] deployed in hunt of surviving [[X Parasite]]s. Shortly after landing, Samus has a near-fatal encounter with a hostile [[raven beak (metroid)|Chozo warrior]], causing her to "forget" many of her latent abilities she arrived with. From then on, her ship's navigation assistant uncovers more information about the circumstances surrounding the planet while guiding Samus back to the surface.

It was originally listed as a [[Nintendo DS]] title "to be announced in the future" in 2005.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Metroid Dread":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metroid_Dread]

title: storefront
body: The front entrance to a store, restaurant or similar establishment. Characters can be doing a variety of activities at the storefront, such as an employee welcoming customers, shoppers entering ready to [[shop]], or likewise leaving with bags of purchased goods. Clothing stores may have one or multiple [[mannequin|mannequins]] [[display|displayed]] behind large glass windows wearing the store's clothing as mock demonstrations. For a restaurant or cafe, a server can be bringing food to diners who are sitting at tables outside the establishment.

title: mizunashi_akari
body:
The main character of the anime and manga series [i][[Aria (manga)|]][/i] and its predecessor, [i]Aqua[/i], Akari is a gondolier in a small company located in a reconstruction of Venice (Neo-Venezia) on Aqua, a water planet terraformed from Mars. Akari's mentor in Aria Company is [[Alicia Florence]], and their company mascot is [[Aria Pokoteng]].

Akari has [[green eyes]] and [[pink hair]]. For the majority of the series she has [[short hair with long locks|short hair and]] [[long sidelocks]] with [[parted bangs]] or [[hair intakes]] (often showing her [[forehead]]) and adorned with [[hair tubes]] or [[hair ribbon]]s. [[aged up|Adult]] Akari has [[very long hair]] and hair tubes that are lower down than usual, with her sidelocks [[hair over shoulder|resting on her shoulders]] and looping back into a [[ponytail]]. This hairstyle is sometimes called a 'momitail' (もみーテール).

Akari is usually depicted wearing her Aria Company [i]undine[/i] [[aria company uniform|uniform]], which is colored white with blue trim and features a [[bowtie]] and a circle-and-arc [[logo]] in front and black company patches with yellow lettering on the left sleeve and [[hat]]. There are summer and winter variations: the summer uniform is topped by a short-sleeved, [[sailor collar|sailor-collared]] shirt, while the winter uniform is characterized by a v-tailed mantle, long sleeves, and [[purple pantyhose]].

h4. See also

* [[Aika Granzchesta]]
* [[Alice Carroll]]

title: vb-6_konig_monster
body:
A fictional heavy variable [[mecha]] from the [[Macross]] series.

The [b]Shin-Nakasu/Northrom Grumman VB-6 König Monster[/b] is a transformable successor of the original [[Monster Destroid]]. 

It can change into [[space shuttle|shuttle]]-shaped space bomber, [[destroid]] and [[gerwalk]] (original Monster Destroid) modes. It is one-third the size and half the weight of its predecessor. Its main armaments are four 320 mm rail guns.

The mecha first appeared in [[Macross VF-X2]] video game. In the [[Macross Frontier]] TV series and Macross Frontier The Movie, the VB-6 belonging to S.M.S was piloted by [[Canaria Berstein]].
It was designed by [[Kawamori Shouji]] using [[Miyatake Kazutaka]]'s original design.

title: van_darkholme
body:
A Vietnamese-American former gay pornographic actor and director. Best known for his [[BDSM]] works. In the [[NicoNico]] and [[Gachimuchi]] fanbase, he is popular next to [[Billy Herrington]] as an internet [[meme]]. In Chinese [[Bilibili]], he is the most popular Gachimuchi character.

Japanese fans call him [b]TDN (TaDaNo) Kosugi[/b] (in reference to [[Tadano Kazuhito]] from [[Manatsu no yo no Inmu]]) or [b]Van-sama[/b], while Chinese fans often call him as [b]Dungeon Master[/b]

His sound was used in almost every Gachimuchi video as instrumental, including his famous phrase [[leatherclub scene (meme)|"Fuck You"]] that he replied to [[Mark Wolff]] after getting mocked for his [[bdsm|leather]] outfit.

His popularity in China is very high, to the point that he was invited to SKY Anime festival in Shanghai, China, in 2019. He's also created his official Bilibili and Twitch account as well.

h4. See also

* [[Billy Herrington]]

title: deftones_(band)
body:
An American alternative metal band formed in Sacramento, [[California]], in 1988. 

The band's most well-known lineup consisted of:
* Chino Moreno (vocalist)
* Stephen Carpenter (guitarist)
* Frank Delgado (keyboardist and samplist)
* Abe Cunningham (drummer)
* Chi Cheng (bassist)

Deftones are known for their heavy, experimental sound, which blends elements of metal, rock, and shoegaze with atmospheric textures and haunting melodies. They rose to prominence in the late 1990s and early 2000s with albums like "Around the Fur" (1997) and "White Pony" (2000), which showcased their unique sound and earned them a dedicated fanbase.

h4. External links

* "Deftones' official website":[https://www.deftones.com]
* "Wikipedia: Deftones":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deftones]
* "YouTube Channel":[https://youtube.com/channel/UCQDsiRE--IQe5ycCLeetIxQ]

title: sunsastera
body:
"Sunsastera: The teen who hates the sun and the machine that can change the weather" is an animation project by Mclelun. A boy discovers that he needs to save his new friends and the world by stopping a powerful weather control airship that spirals out of his control.

h4. Plot Outline

Zul is a shy, quiet teen who was brought up by his overprotective single mother. He has experienced very little of the world, his whole childhood was spent in the labs of Lunacorp with his mother the inventor of Sunsastera, the world’s first weather control airship. Upon the sudden and tragic death of his mother, Zul is raised by his elderly grandfather at Bukit Tabur outside Kuala Lumpur.

Here, Sunsastera begins to communicate with Zul. The next day, Sunsastera appears at Bukit Tabur. A bond forms between the lonely teen and Sunsastera whom very much reminded Zul of his mother. At Bukit Tabur, Zul also meet a boy his age called Ming and his younger sister Mun, fun and impulsive siblings who live nearby and they gradually became friends. Initially, Sunsastera allowed Zul and his friends to use its weather control abilities.

Over time, Zul began to spend less time with Sunsastera. Sunsastera started to resent the relationship between Zul and his new friends. She started to manipulate the weather in order for them to be apart. Angry with Sunsastera, Zul accusing Sunsastera of controlling his life. Lunacorp managed to track Sunsastera and wanted it back. Lunacorp manages to forcefully subdue Sunsastera and take her back to their labs for a full reprogramming so that she could be controlled. At Lunacorp, something goes terribly wrong.

Sunsastera loses her ability to control the weather and weather conditions started to turn bad escalating until it turned violent and destructive, threatening lives. Even the full powers of Lunacorp and the military is unable to stop Sunsastera. Zul and his friends realises that he might have played a part in Sunsastera losing her control. Their only hope was to battle their way through the extreme weather conditions and find a way to go up to the airship in order to stop Sunsastera at her source.

Thus setting out on a dangerous journey in which will end in one of them making the ultimate sacrifice.

h4. External links

* Youtube trailer (Malay): https://youtube.com/watch?v=GJiSVV5qkvQ
* Youtube trailer (English) : https://youtube.com/watch?v=sPhB4TkWb18
* Facebook :  https://facebook.com/Sunsastera
* Website : http://www.mclelun.com/

title: kofji_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21092464
* !asset #21092465
* !asset #21092466

Voice of [[Nazrin]] and [[Kawashiro Nitori]] and [[Kofji (artist)|artist]] in [[cookie_(touhou)|Easter☆]], [[Inaba Tewi]] and [[Nazrin]] in Turkey☆. An American voice actress who lives in Ohio, she also has a [[black_hair|black haired]] avatar that resembles one of her favorites characters, [[Kino (kino no tabi)|]]. Recognizable for her always [[empty eyes]], wearing a [[grey dress]] as Nazrin, and [[messy hair]] as Nitori.

She became popular for her low, monotone, and droning voice. Her most famous line is "”I play a mouse.”":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cGLaIXlRREA&t=1078] (original link deleted, new link "here":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D6QiAFF0HLc&t=1078s]), with a few other of her notable lines being "Hmmmmm", "That'll be [[114514 (meme)|$8.10]]", and a clip of her as Nitori smashing a printer. Her drawings of [[Maru (cookie)|]], [[Sugar (cookie)|]], [[Comfy (cookie)|]], [[Cili (cookie)|]], and the [[Fuckin Animal]]s are usually used as the baseline for derivative art. As she played Nazrin and [[Web (cookie)|]] played Alice, they naturally got compared to [[Nyon (cookie)|]] and [[Ichigo (cookie)|]]. A sub-meme drawing both of them [[policewoman|policewomen]] is popular. 

h4. External links

* "Her Twitter account":https://twitter.com/kofji

title: elona
body:
An indie roguelike game, available in English and Japanese. The game is known for its peculiar sense of humor. It was created by a single author, but was abandoned unfinished. It has since been taken up as an open-source project by multiple modders as "Elona+" and received expansions, but the original plot is likely never to be finished as it was intended.

"Elona" is a portmanteau of "Eternal League Of NefiA", a mysterious (to the point of being only mentioned once in the unfinished plot) organization apparently behind fate. 

Elona takes place on a world called Irva, where the world is tormented by the blowing of the etherwinds, which cause mutations that kill humanoids and make monsters more powerful and ferocious. Because the etherwinds come from the Vindale Forest, home of the [[elf]]-like Elea, the world stands ready to bring war to Vindale.

Elona blends standard RPG tropes with a Lovecraftian theme (including a Sanity meter). It also features guns, cyborgs, steampunk, references to the likes of [[Aliens (1986)|]] and [[Bioshock (series)|]] and many other dissimilar tropes to create an oddball fantasy/sci-fi kitchen sink.

You can read a translation of the plot here: [s]http://elona.squares.net/forum/viewtopic.php?f=3&t=5025[/s]

h4. External links

* [s]http://homepage3.nifty.com/rfish/index_e.html[/s]

title: tantei_monogatari
body:
Tantei Monogatari (Detective Story) "is an action Japanese TV series ... which was originally broadcast on [[Nippon TV]] in 27 forty-five-minute episodes from September 18, 1979 to April 1, 1980." [1]

Matsuda Yusaku (松田 優作) stars as [[Kudou Shunsaku (tantei monogatari)|]] (工藤 俊作), who "sets up office in a rundown building as a private detective after spending five years as a cop in San Francisco where he became familiar with firearms." [1]

A scene of Kudou [[spit take|spitting out]] coffee in the opening credits is frequently parodied. See the scene "here":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=blZR1o8-VWs&t=50s].

h4. External links

* [1] "Wikipedia entry":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tantei_Monogatari

title: queen_of_sunlight_gwynevere
body:
NPC from [[Dark Souls I]]. 

Gwynevere is the daughter of [[gwyn lord of cinder|Lord Gwyn]], making her the Princess of Sunlight. She is located in Anor Londo, in a room above the hall where [[Dragon Slayer Ornstein|Ornstein]] and [[executioner smough|Smough]] battle the [[Chosen Undead]]. She appears in the form of a [[giantess|gigantic]], fair lady with [[red hair|reddish]] [[brown hair]] and a kind face. A light shines brightly behind Gwynevere's figure. She is dressed in white cloth and rests on a cushion underneath her arm.

She bequeathes the Lordvessel to the player, as well as serves as the "Princess Guard" covenant leader.

Gwynevere is often associated with "Why Can't This Be Love?" by Van Halen due to "Dark Souls: A Summary":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M9x_koRZ2bA&t=139s. A lot of "Amazing Chest Ahead" and "Try Holding With Both Hands" player signs are found near her due to [[curvy|her]] [[large breasts|figure]].

h4. External links

* "Dark Souls Wiki: Gwynevere, Princess of Sunlight":http://darksouls.wikia.com/wiki/Gwynevere,_Princess_of_Sunlight
other_names: 太陽の王女グウィネヴィア

title: coco_kaine
body:
An alter ego of [[Kiryu Coco]] from [[Hololive]].

Introduced on "the April 7th, 2020 edition":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fx5EPtKSe0s of AsaCoco, after discussing the then-soon-to-debut Hololive Indonesia, [b]Coco Kaine[/b] is the "first member of Hololive USA", a fictional Virtual YouTuber whose name is a play on cocaine. Following the morning stream, [[Yaman]], Kiryuu's 'mama', drew "a younger rendition":/posts/3865374 of Kaine, which would be discussed on "the April 15th edition":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vkzq3cu5VC4 of AsaCoco.

Ironically, Kaine's CM would predate Hololive's announcement of Hololive EN later that April, so she would later appear on "the May 6th edition":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tYGyZKiht18&t=867 of AsaCoco at the start of Kiryuu's Hololive EN CM.

h4. Related tags

title: the_a-team
body:
American TV action drama series produced by NBC Television and broadcast from 1983 to 1987. This extremely popular TV series was remade into a film in 2010.

h4. Characters

* [[John "Hannibal" Smith]]
* [[Templeton "Faceman" Peck]]
* [[H.M. "Howling Mad" Murdock]]
* [[B.A. Baracus]] (played by [[Mr T]])

* [[Amy Amanda "Triple A" Allen]]
* [[Tawnia Baker]]
* [[Frankie "Dishpan Man" Santana]]
* [[General Hunt Stockwell]]

h4. Japanese history

It was also televised in Japan from 1985 with the title 特攻野郎Aチーム ("[i]Tokkou Yarou A-Team[/i]" lit. "Special Attack Bastards A-Team"). In the Japanese dubbed version, Bosco Albert Baracus's nickname was changed from "B.A." to "Kong", H. M. Murdock's from "Howling Mad" to "Crazy Monkey" and Amy Amanda Allen's from "Triple A" to "Angel".

The popularity of this series in Japan was due not only to its content and the good quality of the dubbing, but also to the self-introductory voiceovers by each member of the team, which were added to the opening sequence. These opening lines are so famous that if you were to do a search with those Japanese keywords, you would be able to find an endless number of parodies on the web.

[quote]We were members of a special attack force, well known in Vietnam. We were arrested by the authorities under false accusations but we managed to escape from prison and went underground. However, we were not the type of people to simply fester underground. We are a team of reckless men who are capable of anything, as long as we are well paid and the reason is justifiable; we make the impossible possible; we destroy great evils; we are the Tokkou Yarou A-Team!

"I am the leader, Colonel John Smith. Also known as Hannibal. I am a master of disguise and an expert in ambush tactics. If it wasn't because I am such a gifted strategist, I wouldn't be the leader of such a strong team of veterans."

"I am Templeton Peck. Also known as Faceman. Women always surrender to my amazing looks. I can bluff my way through life and I can get you anything, from bras to missiles, you'll see!"

"I am Amy Amanda Allen, also known as Angel. I am the only woman in the team. Intelligence gathering is my speciality, with my pretty face and bright brain!"

"Heeey, sorry to keep you waiting! I am Murdock. Also known as Crazy Monkey. My skills as a pilot are second to none! 
An eccentric? A weird character? So what?"

"I am B. A. Baracus, also known as Kong. I am a genius mechanic. I would even punch the President! But, just don't make me get on a plane!"

We challenge this unreasonable world. We are reliable and ubiquitous, the [i]Tokkou Yarou[/i] A-Team! If you need any help, just call us any time. 
[/quote]

h4. See also

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_A-Team
* Youtube: "The A-Team - Opening (Japanese Ver.)":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ctovammXPh4&t=1m2s

Elira has [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]],  [[multicolored hair|with]] [[white hair|white trim]], [[blue wings|blue]] [[head wings]], [[x hair ornament]] and [[bangs]] [[one eye covered|covering]] her [[hair over one eye|left eye]]. Her right eye is [[aqua eyes|aqua]], while her character sheet revealed that she shares her sister's [[heterochromia]] with her left eye being [[purple eyes|purple]]. title: mach_rider_(character)
body:
[quote]YOU ARE "MACH RIDER"![/quote]

The titular main protagonist of [[Mach Rider]]. Riding a [[motorcycle]] mounted with [[machine gun]]s, he is Earth's last hope in fighting back against the invading alien forces as he searches for a new frontier. 

His trophy and music theme in [i][[Super Smash Bros.]] Melee[/i] gained him greater recognition. 

It is debated that Mach Rider is possibly a woman. This is due to [i]Vs. Mach Rider[/i], the arcade version, slowly reveals a skimpy woman holding a knife next to Mach Rider's bike the more levels you complete, with beating the final level revealing her fully[tn]"[1]":[https://www.vgmuseum.com/end/arcade/b/vsmachrider.htm][/tn][tn]"[2]":[https://youtu.be/HNYmaLtm8_w?t=985][/tn]. This is further fueled by the Japanese gaming magazine "High Score" September 1986 issue, which had a pin-up poster of a female Mach Rider[tn]"[3]":[https://twitter.com/Shino4know/status/1365149590085894144][/tn][tn]"[4]":[https://pbs.twimg.com/media/EvFcrFYUYAIdSx3.jpg:orig][/tn], created by Yasuo Torai (虎井安夫) and Yasuhiro Kagami (鏡泰裕). No context was ever given who these women are, leading to speculation.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24255989: Cover Art
* !asset #24255993: Vs. Mach Rider
* !asset #24255995: Super Smash Bros. Melee

title: ina's_back_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] related to [[Ninomae Ina'nis]]' [[bare back]] (and occasionally, her [[ass]]). It originates from a certain moment during a [[holoMyth]] off-collab "3D stream":[https://youtu.be/3wsiJVzv9vg?t=1793], in which Ina, using her 3D avatar, briefly exposed the rarely-seen back side of her body directly at the camera. On top of that, the quick spin caused her [[waist cape]] to glitch and  ending up in a position that have very strong impression of [[wide hips]]/[[huge ass]], leading to a large surge of fanart  [[back focus|focusing on her back]] (and [[ass focus|her ass]] too). Additionally, "Ina's back" doubles nicely as a pun, as the event coincided with Ina returning from an extended break.

Be mindful when using this tag. Don't add it to every single [[back focus]]/[[ass focus]] or [[from behind]] posts featuring Ina. The image has to be a clear reference to the incident.

h4. External links

* "Imgur: Original screenshot":https://i.imgur.com/2TkRU67.png
* "Youtube:【OFF COLLAB】ARMWRESTLING BATTLE w/ HoloMyth!":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3wsiJVzv9vg]

title: censored_pomu
body:
An evil [[eldritch abomination]] version of [[Pomu Rainpuff]] in a horrifying, distorted blood-red form. She first appeared in Pomu's "short  horror-themed pseudo-ARG collaboration":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7FOB5jnb3hw] with [[Elira Pendora]] as a red-colored Pomu with a demonic voice. With the addition of [[Ethyria]], her appearance has become much more hauntingly ghost-like, and she is almost always seen donning a copy of [[Reimu Endou]]'s [[hat]].

The name [b]Censored Pomu[/b] comes from her membership emotes, where the emoji depicting this Pomu is simply named ":pomuCensored:". Also known as [b]Cursed Pomu[/b].

h4. External links

* "Origin of Post-Ethyria Censored Pomu":[https://twitter.com/PomuRainpuff/status/1446497971340824578]
* "First appearance of Post-Ethyria Censored Pomu on stream":[https://youtu.be/YjXEcLlNSTg?t=2678]

title: ign_x_va-11_hall-a_contest
body:
The [i]IGN x VA-11 HALL-A[/i] fanart contest ran from October 21 to November 3, 2017.

The contest was held in anticipation of the Japanese PS Vita release of [i][[VA-11 HALL-A]][/i].
Contestants entered by tweeting their illustration with the hashtag "#IGNxVA11HallAイラコン":[https://twitter.com/hashtag/IGNxVA11HallA%E3%82%A4%E3%83%A9%E3%82%B3%E3%83%B3].

h4. Prizes [2]

[quote]
* 最優秀賞（1名）：PS Vitaパッケージ版「VA-11 Hall-A」初回特典付（サウンドトラックCDとコースター）
* 敢闘賞（10名）：「VA-11 Hall-A」Steam キー（発売に合わせて日本語がアップデート予定。既にお買上げの方は布教用に使おう！）
* 参加賞（抽選で20名）：「VA-11 Hall-A」ノベルティ用ポストカード
[/quote]

h4. Results [2]

Below are the contest results. 
The creators of [i]VA-11 HALL-A[/i], [[kiririn51|Christopher Ortiz]] (design and illustration) and Fernando Damas (writing and programming), wrote comments about each of the winning entries. In some cases, these comments have been included in the Commentary of the below linked posts.

* Grand prize
** [[bamboo (merenge doll)|merenge doll]] - post #3034507

* Fighting Spirit Prize (Runner up)
** 

* Fighting Spirit Prize (9 awarded) 敢闘賞9名 - 敢闘賞（10名）：「VA-11 Hall-A」Steam キー（発売に合わせて日本語がアップデート予定。既にお買上げの方は布教用に使おう！）
** [[Tsujita Daisuke]]  - post #3034483, post #3034489

h4. External links

* "Contest announcement and rules":[http://jp.ign.com/vallhalla/18564/news/va-11-hall-a]
* [2] "Contest results":[http://jp.ign.com/vallhalla/19287/news/va-11-hall-a]
* "Twitter #IGNxVA11HallAイラコン":[https://twitter.com/hashtag/IGNxVA11HallA%E3%82%A4%E3%83%A9%E3%82%B3%E3%83%B3]

body:

title: js_kaga_(ddh-184)
body:
The second ship of the Izumo-class "helicopter carrier destroyers" (DDH-184) that was launched on 27 August 2015 and later "converted" into an [[aircraft carrier]]. Also the first ship to bear the Kaga name since the Tosa-class battleship turned aircraft carrier from World War II.

Consequently, she has appeared in art featuring her [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i] [[Kaga (Kancolle)|version]], including in "official art":[https://twitter.com/ko131415/status/1064360710514237441] shown on an on-deck poster.

body:
A Vietnamese [[indie virtual youtuber|indie VTuber]]. Her character model was designed by [[Kannazuki Genshi]]. 

She has two forms: humanoid form and cat form. Originally she was a black cat who is addicted to eating strawberry to the point she become a pink cat and able to speak human language. After sometime she evolved into a humanoid form. She has two personalities depending on her eyes color (red eyes for fiery personality but that eyes were formerly yellow, blue eyes for her normal persona of cuteness and friendliness).

title: fire_emblem_heroes
body:
[b]Fire Emblem Heroes[/b] (ファイアーエムブレムヒーローズ [i]Faiaa Emuburemu Hiiroozu[/i]) is a turn-based strategy mobile app based on the [i][[Fire Emblem]][/i] series published by [[Nintendo]]. It is the series' first step into the mobile platform. The story revolves around the fight between the Emblian Empire, whose desire is to take over all worlds, and the kingdom of Askr, who opposes them. To fight back, a [[kiran_(fire_emblem)|Summoner]] capable of summoning heroes from different worlds was called from our world by [[anna_(fire_emblem)|Anna]]. As the Summoner, the player must call forth the various heroes of [i]Fire Emblem[/i] and devise strategies for them as a tactician. h4. Characters h5. Main
[b]Kingdom of Askr[/b] [b]Emblian Empire[/b]

h5. Featured Heroes * See [[List of Fire Emblem Characters]]. h5. Hero Classifications At the time of writing, Heroes in the game can be grouped into the following types: [expand] * Regular: Refers to Heroes in their standard, default versions. Often as they'd be seen during their respective games. ** Fallen: Refers to Heroes as corrupted versions of their regular selves. The game treats them as regular Heroes for many purposes. ** Brave: Refers to Heroes as idealized versions of themselves manifested by the imagination of the people. Determined each year by voting, their appearance, personality and weapons vary greatly. The game treats them as regular Heroes for summoning purposes but as Special Heroes for others. ** Resplendent: Refers to Heroes (Regular or Brave) wearing special regalia associated to one of the game-original kingdoms. * Special: Catch-all term used to refer to Heroes wearing costumes themed after various festivities or events, be they game-specific or game-equivalents. ** Day of Devotion (Valentine's Day equivalent) ** Spring (Easter equivalent) ** Bridal (self-explanatory) ** Children (loli/shota versions) ** Desert Festival (themed around desert locales from different games) ** Wind Festival (themed around wind tribes) ** Flame Festival (themed around flame tribes) ** Picnic (has not been re-used) ** Hot Springs (has not been re-used) ** Summer (Swimsuits) ** Harvest Festival (Halloween/Oktoberfest equivalent) ** Thief Festival (themed around phantom thieves) ** Ninja Festival (self-explanatory) ** Pirate Festival (self-explanatory) ** Day of 12 (has not been re-used; game-specific) ** Winter Festival (Christmas equivalent) ** New Year's (self-explanatory) * Legendary: Refers to Heroes typically in their end-game states. * Mythic: Refers to Heroes that are myths from their own timelines (gods, progenitors etc) or FEH-original characters * Emblem: Refers to Heroes that are protagonists of mainline games as interpreted within [[Fire Emblem Engage|Engage]]'s system, where they're spirits/stands existing wtihin special rings. * Rearmed: Refers to Heroes wielding special, cursed weapons. Valuable in-game due to their special properties during inheritance. * Attuned: Refers to Heroes wielding special skills. Valuable in-game due to their special properties during inheritance. * Ascended: Refers to Heroes often in their post-game state. Valuble in-game due to brining extremely-limited items with them. [/expand] h4. External Links * "Official Website":https://fire-emblem-heroes.com/ * "Official Twitter (JP)":https://twitter.com/fe_heroes_jp * "Fire Emblem Heroes Wiki":[https://feheroes.gamepedia.com/Main_Page] * "Wikipedia: Fire Emblem Heroes":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fire_Emblem_Heroes]
other_names: ファイアーエムブレムヒーローズ

title: ultraman_80
body:
The titular Ultra of [[Ultraman 80 (series)|]]. His human form is [[Yamato Takeshi]]. 80 was a teacher at the Sakura-ga-Oka Middle School. He theorized that monsters originated from Minus Energy, which is created from the negative emotions of humans. 80 is a well known teacher from the Land of Light and was the last Ultra Warrior assigned to protect Earth in the M78 timeline until [[Ultraman Mebius]]' arrival in 2006.

h4. Appearance

title: eren_yeager
body:
The main character of [[Shingeki no Kyojin]].

The 5th best trainee from the 104th Trainees Squad. No particular skills besides his excellent close combat ability and strong sense of purpose. An impulsive and violent young man, his dream is to annihilate all Titans and discover the world outside the walls. [[Mikasa Ackerman]] is his adopted sister, as her parents have passed away. He's good friends with [[Armin Arlert]].

Voiced by [[Kaji Yuuki]].

title: volunteer_army_(russia)
body:
The [b]Russian Volunteer Army[/b] was a White movement force in the Russian Civil War (1917–1920), initially formed in Novocherkassk with 3,000–4,000 volunteers. Founded in December 1917 by General [[Mikhail Alekseyev]] and General [[Lavr Kornilov]], it fought the Bolsheviks in South Russia, including during the "Ice March" and Kuban Offensive. [[Anton Denikin]] took command after Kornilov’s death in 1918, peaking at 40,000 troops in 1919 before its evacuation under [[Pyotr Wrangel]] in 1920.

They are recognisable through the [[russian_flag|Russian tricolour]] [[chevron_(symbol)|chevron]] they don on their sleeve.

h4. See Also

[[Imperial Russian Army]]
[[Russian Civil War]]
[[White Army]]

title: kornilov_shock_regiment
body:
The [b]Kornilov Shock Regiment[/b] was an elite unit of the [[Imperial Russian Army]] formed during [[World War I]], later becoming a cornerstone of the [[White Army]] in the [[Russian Civil War]]. Established in June 1917 under [[Lavr Kornilov]], commander of the Russian Eighth Army, it began as the 1st Shock Detachment to counter the crumbling discipline of the post-February Revolution army. Initiated by [[Aleksei Brusilov]]’s call for "revolutionary shock battalions," the unit was renamed in Kornilov’s honor in August 1917 and became known for its fierce loyalty and combat prowess.

Led initially by Captain [[Mitrofan Nezhentsev]], the regiment grew from a volunteer force of officers and soldiers into a symbol of anti-Bolshevik resistance. After the [[October Revolution]], it joined Lavr Kornilov in southern Russia, becoming one of the first units of the Volunteer Army alongside generals like [[Mikhail Alekseyev]] and [[Anton Denikin]]. The regiment fought in major campaigns, including the [[Ice March of 1918]], where Kornilov died in battle. It later expanded into a brigade and division, enduring heavy losses until its evacuation from Crimea in 1920 under [[Pyotr Wrangel]].

The Kornilovites were renowned for their distinctive red-and-black uniforms and skull-and-crossbones insignia, reflecting their oath to fight to the death. They clashed repeatedly with the [[soviet_army|Red Army]], led by figures like [[Leon Trotsky]], and remained a disciplined force amid the chaos of civil war.

h4. Common Themes
Depictions often include:

* Soldiers in red-and-black [[peaked cap|peaked caps]] and [[shoulder boards]] with a white "K."
* [[Skull and crossbones]] patches, symbolising their commitment to sacrifice.

h4. See Also

[[Imperial Russian Army]] - The regiment’s origins in World War I.
[[Russian Civil War]] - The conflict where it gained prominence.
[[volunteer_army_(russia)|Volunteer Army]] - The White force it helped establish.
[[White Army]] - The broader anti-Bolshevik movement.
